name: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION
mission: SAMS works to serve the medical needs of patients in need, regardless of religious background, race, ethnicity, or political affiliation.
zakatClaimEvidence: SAMS is Zakat-eligible. You can fulfill your Zakat by donating through the Ramadan page and designating it toward: Medical treatment. Essential medications. Emergency care. Support for the most vulnerable families. (Source: https://sams-usa.net/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: SAMS is Zakat-eligible. You can fulfill your Zakat by donating through the Ramadan page and designating it toward: Medical treatment. Essential medications. Emergency care. Support for the most vulnerable families. (Source: https://sams-usa.net/donate/)

all_citations.claim: SAMS maintains a program expense ratio of 95.6% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
The organization reported total revenue of $99,929,862 and holds 4.6 months of working capital.
SAMS provides medical services and therapy that have resulted in a reduction in PTSD symptoms.
The organization operates medical services inside Syria to address the impact of conflict on mental health.
all_citations.source_name: Human Devastation Syndrome: The Impact of Conflict on Mental Health

all_citations.claim: SAMS facilitates support groups for children in Jordan and Syria as part of its medical service provision.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and offers various giving methods for donors.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAMS earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct impact in high-urgency conflict zones. The organization maintains a strong balance between immediate humanitarian response and sustainable medical education.
areas_for_improvement: Expansion of long-term mental health support groups for children in conflict zones
Increasing the availability of specialized medical education for local practitioners

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization is highly aligned with donor priorities for global health and humanitarian aid, maintaining a Zakat-eligible status for eligible programs [6]. Its mission to serve all patients regardless of religious or political affiliation, combined with a high degree of transparency and a strong track record in crisis zones, makes it a high-fit option for international relief donors [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAMS demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, providing critical medical services and mental health interventions that have shown measurable reductions in PTSD symptoms among patients [3][5]. The foundation operates with a high program expense ratio of 95.6%, reflecting a strong commitment to directing resources toward patient care and humanitarian response [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Syrian American Medical Society Foundation provides life-saving medical relief and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations regardless of background or affiliation.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 95.6%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach direct services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 4.6 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Syrian American Medical Society (SAMS) Foundation is a humanitarian organization dedicated to addressing the medical needs of patients through primary and specialty healthcare centers, emergency response, and medical education [1][3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $99,929,862 to support its extensive network of medical services inside Syria and neighboring countries [2][4].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAMS earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct impact in high-urgency conflict zones. The organization maintains a strong balance between immediate humanitarian response and sustainable medical education.

areas_for_improvement.area: Program Expense Ratio Relative to Peers
areas_for_improvement.context: While SAMS maintains a <cite id="2">95.6% program expense ratio</cite>, this falls below the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 88.2%</cite>.
The organization lacks a formally documented theory of change with an explicit causal pathway for its interventions.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB Wise Giving Alliance assessment data is not currently available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization operates in highly complex, high-risk conflict zones which naturally increases operational and logistical costs.
risk_factors: Program expense ratio is below peer median
case_against.summary: The primary financial consideration is that the <cite id="2">95.6% program expense ratio</cite> is lower than the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 88.2%</cite>.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data availability, but lacking detailed impact evaluation metrics.

known_gaps: No formal theory of change documented

alignment.explanation: The organization is highly aligned with Muslim donor priorities, operating in Muslim-majority regions and offering <cite id="7">zakat-eligible</cite> programs for the fuqara and masakin.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust SAMS due to its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid and strong governance, featuring a fully independent board.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more detailed audited financial statements directly on its website.

impact.explanation: SAMS delivers direct medical services with exceptional fundraising efficiency of <cite id="3">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite> and a <cite id="2">95.6% program expense ratio</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but missing cost-per-beneficiary data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: SAMS primarily operates as a direct service provider rather than a grantmaking institution.

rich_narrative.headline: The Syrian American Medical Society Foundation provides life-saving medical relief and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations regardless of background or affiliation.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide emergency medical relief to vulnerable populations in conflict zones like Syria and Gaza through zakat-eligible giving.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations by funding direct medical care
Care deeply about the humanitarian crises in Syria and Gaza
Value organizations with massive operational scale and reach
giving_considerations: Program expense ratio is slightly lower than some peers
Operates in high-risk conflict zones with inherent logistical challenges
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with the absolute highest program expense ratios or those focused strictly on domestic US healthcare.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks verified outcomes, such as <cite id="5">3,500,000 medical services</cite>, but lacks comprehensive cost-per-beneficiary data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAMS provides direct medical services to alleviate suffering, though a formal causal pathway is not explicitly documented.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions are not only delivered but are effectively improving health outcomes in crisis settings.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The ongoing crises in Syria, Gaza, and neighboring regions present massive, unmet medical needs that exceed current funding capacity.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Syria, Jordan, Lebanon, Turkey, Egypt, Iraq, Gaza, Libya, Ukraine, Morocco

peer_comparison.differentiator: SAMS is distinguished by its massive scale of <cite id="6">3,200,000 medical services inside Syria</cite> and specialized focus on conflict-zone healthcare.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on direct healthcare and humanitarian relief in the Middle East
similar_organizations.name: PALESTINE CHILDRENS RELIEF FUND

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar size and focus on direct healthcare in crisis zones
similar_organizations.name: MedGlobal

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar size but focused more broadly on preventable blindness and malnutrition
similar_organizations.name: Helen Keller International

strengths.detail: The organization is highly efficient at generating support, spending only <cite id="3">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>.
SAMS delivers critical healthcare at an immense scale, providing <cite id="5">3,500,000 medical services</cite> to vulnerable populations.
The organization has demonstrated strong financial momentum with a <cite id="8">54.2% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: SAMS Foundation combines massive operational scale with strong financial resilience. The organization reported <cite id="1">$99,929,862 in total revenue</cite> in 2023, supported by a <cite id="8">54.2% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. Their direct service model is highly active in conflict zones, delivering <cite id="6">3,200,000 medical services inside Syria</cite> alone. Furthermore, the charity holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid, reflecting a commitment to clear outcome reporting.
rich_narrative.summary: The Syrian American Medical Society (SAMS) Foundation is a global medical relief organization that provides life-saving healthcare and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations. <cite id="4">founded in 1998</cite>, the organization has grown significantly, reporting <cite id="1">$99,929,862 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. SAMS operates extensively in conflict zones, delivering over <cite id="5">3,500,000 medical services</cite> globally, including <cite id="6">3,200,000 medical services inside Syria</cite>. The organization maintains a <cite id="2">95.6% program expense ratio</cite> and demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="3">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. As a <cite id="7">zakat-eligible</cite> organization, SAMS provides a critical avenue for Muslim donors to support emergency medical response, mental health programs, and essential health services in regions like Syria, Gaza, and Lebanon.
